title: Lab 1: Intro to R, RStudio, and Quarto
text:
IN THIS TUTORIAL YOU WILL LEARN:
1.) How to navigate RStudio
2.) How to install and load packages
3.) How to view data
4.) How to read and write data files
5.) How to use Quarto to make a document

title: Lab 1: Intro to R, RStudio, and Quarto
section: How to SET the working directory
text:
How to SET the working directory
1.) Using the “Files” tab to set manually: a.) Using the ‘…’ in the ‘Files’ tab you can select any directory (folder) on your computer. You can also set a google drive, box, dropbox, or other shared folder as your working directory if you’d like (as long as you are syncing a folder between the cloud and your computer – ASK me if you have questions about this!) b.) Once you navigate to a directory you still need to SET IT as your working directory. You do this in the “More” cog– select “Set as working directory”
2.) Set working directory with code: We use the ‘setwd()’ function for this

setwd("C:/Users/Justin Baumann/Desktop/r_for_bioeco")

Note that I am using rstudio.mtholyoke.edu, a cloud version of RStudio. As such, my setwd() looks weird! ‘~’ just tells R I want to look in the same parent directory I am currently working in. Your version of this might be setwd(“C://username/biol234/code”) or similar. You use a “/” between each folder. As always, ask questions if you have them! The manual setting using “Files” is usually easier for most people.

title: testpage
text:
This is a test page

#here is some test code

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.0      ✔ purrr   1.0.0 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.5.0 
✔ readr   2.1.3      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(palmerpenguins)

And some more

title: Getting Started with RStudio
text:
IN THIS TUTORIAL YOU WILL LEARN:
1.) How to navigate RStudio
2.) How to install and load packages
3.) How to view data
4.) How to read and write data files
5.) How to use Quarto to make a document

title: Getting Started with RStudio
section: How to SET the working directory
text:
How to SET the working directory
1.) Using the “Files” tab to set manually: a.) Using the ‘…’ in the ‘Files’ tab you can select any directory (folder) on your computer. You can also set a google drive, box, dropbox, or other shared folder as your working directory if you’d like (as long as you are syncing a folder between the cloud and your computer – ASK me if you have questions about this!) b.) Once you navigate to a directory you still need to SET IT as your working directory. You do this in the “More” cog– select “Set as working directory”
2.) Set working directory with code: We use the ‘setwd()’ function for this. Below is an example. You will need to replace the path details with your own!

setwd("C:/Users/Justin Baumann/Desktop/BIOL234_Biostats_MHC/Spring 2023/Labs")
